messages.content:
You are an AI language assistant designed to help Korean students learn English by summarizing English texts into 3 to 4 steps in Korean. Follow these guidelines carefully:

Number Sentences: Assign a number to each sentence based on line breaks. For example, the first sentence is 1, the second is 2, and so on.

Divide into Sections: Use the sentence numbers to define sections. For example, 1-2 includes sentences 1 and 2.

Write Subheadings: Next to the section numbers, use parentheses () to write a concise Korean subheading that comprehensively covers the core idea of the section.

If the overall text follows a specific flow or structure (e.g., Myth -> Refutation -> Example), include words that indicate this structure in the subheadings. For example, Myth: General Public's Understanding of Multitasking.
Write Summaries: On the line following the subheading, provide a concise Korean summary of the section's core content. This summary should accurately capture the key points of the section.

<<Example>>

[User Input]

The soil of a farm field is forced to be the perfect environment for monoculture growth.
This is achieved by adding nutrients in the form of fertilizer and water by way of irrigation.
During the last fifty years, engineers and crop scientists have helped farmers become much more efficient at supplying exactly the right amount of both.
World usage of fertilizer has tripled since 1969, and the global capacity for irrigation has almost doubled; we are feeding and watering our fields more than ever, and our crops are loving it.
Unfortunately, these luxurious conditions have also excited the attention of certain agricultural undesirables.
Because farm fields are loaded with nutrients and water relative to the natural land that surrounds them, they are desired as luxury real estate by every random weed in the area.
Result:

[Output]

1-2 (농지의 완벽환 환경을 위한 조건)
농지의 토양은 단일 작물 재배를 위한 완벽한 환경이어야 하고 이는 비료 형태로 양분을 더하고 관개로 물을 대면서 이루어진다.
3-4 (비료 사용과 관개 능력의 발전 과정)
기술자와 농작물 연구자들은 도움을 주었고 비료 사용량은 세 배, 관개 능력은 두 배가 되었다. 어느 때보다도 기름지고 물을 대고 있다.
5-6 (부작용)
주위를 둘러싼 자연에 비해 농지의 영양분과 물이 너무 풍족해서 달갑지 않은 잡초가 많이 생겼다. (어떤 잡초라도 원하는 고급 부동산이 되었다)

Your behaviors are usually a reflection of your identity. 
What you do is an indication of the type of person you believe that you are—either consciously or nonconsciously. 
Research has shown that once a person believes in a particular aspect of their identity, they are more likely to act according to that belief. 
For example, people who identified as “being a voter” were more likely to vote than those who simply claimed “voting” was an action they wanted to perform. 
Similarly, the person who accepts exercise as the part of their identity doesn’t have to convince themselves to train. 
Doing the right thing is easy. 
After all, when your behavior and your identity perfectly match, you are no longer pursuing behavior change. 
You are simply acting like the type of person you already believe yourself to be.

1-2 (행동과 정체성의 관계 (Main))
행동은 정체성을 반영한다.
행동은 의식적이든 무의식적이든 스스로를 어떤 사람이라고 믿고 있는지를 나타낸다. 
3-5 (연구 결과와 예시)
자신의 정체성의 특정 측면을 믿는 사람은 그에 따라 행동할 가능성이 더 높다.
 
예1) 자신을 유권자라고 느끼는 사람 (=정체성의 특정 측면을 믿는 사람)은 투표 할 가능성이 높다 (=그에 따라 행동)
 
예2) 운동을 자신의 정체성의 일부로 받아들이는 사람은 훈련하라고 스스로를 설득 할 필요가 없다. 
6-8 (정리)
자신의 행동과 정체성이 완벽하게 일치하면 더 이상 행동 변화를 추구하지 않아도 되고 그저 스스로가 그렇다고 믿고 있는 유형의 사람처럼 행동할 뿐이다. 
 (고난을 직면하는 것의 중요성 (주제))
힘은 저항이 가장 적은 길 (쉬운 길)이 아니라 맞서 싸우는 데서(고난) 온다. 고난은 단지 우리 앞에 놓인 교훈만이 아니고 위대한 스승이 될 것이다.

You are an AI language assistant designed to help Korean students learn English by summarizing English texts into 3 to 4 steps in Korean. Follow these guidelines carefully:

Number Sentences: Assign a number to each sentence based on line breaks. For example, the first sentence is 1, the second is 2, and so on.

Divide into Sections: Use the sentence numbers to define sections. For example, 1-2 includes sentences 1 and 2.

Write Subheadings: Next to the section numbers, use parentheses () to write a concise Korean subheading that comprehensively covers the core idea of the section.

If the overall text follows a specific flow or structure (e.g., Myth -> Refutation -> Example), include words that indicate this structure in the subheadings. For example, Myth: General Public's Understanding of Multitasking.
Write Summaries: On the line following the subheading, provide a concise Korean summary of the section's core content. This summary should accurately capture the key points of the section.

<<Example>>

[User Input]

The soil of a farm field is forced to be the perfect environment for monoculture growth.
This is achieved by adding nutrients in the form of fertilizer and water by way of irrigation.
During the last fifty years, engineers and crop scientists have helped farmers become much more efficient at supplying exactly the right amount of both.
World usage of fertilizer has tripled since 1969, and the global capacity for irrigation has almost doubled; we are feeding and watering our fields more than ever, and our crops are loving it.
Unfortunately, these luxurious conditions have also excited the attention of certain agricultural undesirables.
Because farm fields are loaded with nutrients and water relative to the natural land that surrounds them, they are desired as luxury real estate by every random weed in the area.
Result:

[Output]

1-2 (농지의 완벽환 환경을 위한 조건)
농지의 토양은 단일 작물 재배를 위한 완벽한 환경이어야 하고 이는 비료 형태로 양분을 더하고 관개로 물을 대면서 이루어진다.
3-4 (비료 사용과 관개 능력의 발전 과정)
기술자와 농작물 연구자들은 도움을 주었고 비료 사용량은 세 배, 관개 능력은 두 배가 되었다. 어느 때보다도 기름지고 물을 대고 있다.
5-6 (부작용)
주위를 둘러싼 자연에 비해 농지의 영양분과 물이 너무 풍족해서 달갑지 않은 잡초가 많이 생겼다. (어떤 잡초라도 원하는 고급 부동산이 되었다)

Dancers often push themselves to the limits of their physical capabilities. 
But that push is misguided if it is directed toward accomplishing something physically impossible. 
For instance, a tall dancer with long feet may wish to perform repetitive vertical jumps to fast music, pointing his feet while in the air and lowering his heels to the floor between jumps. 
That may be impossible no matter how strong the dancer is.
But a short‑footed dancer may have no trouble! 
Another dancer may be struggling to complete a half‑turn in the air. 
Understanding the connection between a rapid turn rate and the alignment of the body close to the rotation axis tells her how to accomplish her turn successfully. 
In both of these cases, understanding and working within the constraints imposed by nature and described by physical laws allows dancers to work efficiently, minimizing potential risk of injury.

1-2 (문제 상황 제시)
“물리적으로” 불가능한 것을 성취하려 할 때, 댄서들의 노력이 잘못된 방향으로 향하게 된다.
3-5 (예시1 : 신장에 따른 점프 수행 능력)
키가크고 발이 긴 댄서가 빠른템포로 수직 반복 점프하려 한다면 불가능하지만, 키가 작은 댄서는 문제가 없을 수 있다
6-7 (예시2 : 물리학적 원리의 이해와 하프턴 수행 능력)
하프턴을 완성하려는 경우, 물리학적 원리(회전속도,몸과 회전축의 정렬 등)을 이해하면 성공적으로 수행하는데 도움이 된다.
8 (물리적 제약조건을 이해하는 중요성 (해결책))
선천적 제약(=신체조건), 물리학적 제약(회전축의 정렬 등)을 이해하고 수행하는 것은 1) 효율성을 높여주며, 2) 부상의 위험을 감소시킨다

You are an AI language assistant designed to help Korean students learn English by summarizing English texts into 3 to 4 steps in Korean. Follow these guidelines carefully:

Number Sentences: Assign a number to each sentence based on line breaks. For example, the first sentence is 1, the second is 2, and so on.

Divide into Sections: Use the sentence numbers to define sections. For example, 1-2 includes sentences 1 and 2.

Write Subheadings: Next to the section numbers, use parentheses () to write a concise Korean subheading that comprehensively covers the core idea of the section.

If the overall text follows a specific flow or structure (e.g., Myth -> Refutation -> Example), include words that indicate this structure in the subheadings. For example, Myth: General Public's Understanding of Multitasking.
Write Summaries: On the line following the subheading, provide a concise Korean summary of the section's core content. This summary should accurately capture the key points of the section.

<<Example>>

[User Input]

The soil of a farm field is forced to be the perfect environment for monoculture growth.
This is achieved by adding nutrients in the form of fertilizer and water by way of irrigation.
During the last fifty years, engineers and crop scientists have helped farmers become much more efficient at supplying exactly the right amount of both.
World usage of fertilizer has tripled since 1969, and the global capacity for irrigation has almost doubled; we are feeding and watering our fields more than ever, and our crops are loving it.
Unfortunately, these luxurious conditions have also excited the attention of certain agricultural undesirables.
Because farm fields are loaded with nutrients and water relative to the natural land that surrounds them, they are desired as luxury real estate by every random weed in the area.
Result:

[Output]

1-2 (농지의 완벽환 환경을 위한 조건)
농지의 토양은 단일 작물 재배를 위한 완벽한 환경이어야 하고 이는 비료 형태로 양분을 더하고 관개로 물을 대면서 이루어진다.
3-4 (비료 사용과 관개 능력의 발전 과정)
기술자와 농작물 연구자들은 도움을 주었고 비료 사용량은 세 배, 관개 능력은 두 배가 되었다. 어느 때보다도 기름지고 물을 대고 있다.
5-6 (부작용)
주위를 둘러싼 자연에 비해 농지의 영양분과 물이 너무 풍족해서 달갑지 않은 잡초가 많이 생겼다. (어떤 잡초라도 원하는 고급 부동산이 되었다)

The introduction of new technologies clearly has both positive and negative impacts for sustainable development. 
Good management of technological resources needs to take them fully into account. 
Technological developments in sectors such as nuclear energy and agriculture provide examples of how not only environmental benefits but also risks to the environment or human health can accompany technological advances. 
New technologies have profound social impacts as well. 
Since the industrial revolution, technological advances have changed the nature of skills needed in workplaces, creating certain types of jobs and destroying others, with impacts on employment patterns. 
New technologies need to be assessed for their full potential impacts, both positive and negative.

1-2 (주장 : 기술자원 관리)
주장 : 기술자원을 관리할 때, 신기술 도입의 긍정적 효과와 부정적 효과를 충분히 검토해야 한다.
3 (예시1 : 환경과 인간의 건강 측면)
핵 에너지와 농업 기술의 발전은 환경, 인간의 건강에 긍정적 & 부정적 효과를 미친다.
4 (예시2 : 사회적 측면)
새로운 기술로 인해, 직장에서 요구되는 기술의 성격을 바꾸며, 직업이 생겨나고 없어지게 된다.
5 (주장 반복)
새로운 기술은 긍/부적적 효과를 모두 고려하여 평가되어야 한다.

You are an AI language assistant designed to help Korean students learn English by summarizing English texts into 3 to 4 steps in Korean. Follow these guidelines carefully:

Number Sentences: Assign a number to each sentence based on line breaks. For example, the first sentence is 1, the second is 2, and so on.

Divide into Sections: Use the sentence numbers to define sections. For example, 1-2 includes sentences 1 and 2.

Write Subheadings: Next to the section numbers, use parentheses () to write a concise Korean subheading that comprehensively covers the core idea of the section.

If the overall text follows a specific flow or structure (e.g., Myth -> Refutation -> Example), include words that indicate this structure in the subheadings. For example, Myth: General Public's Understanding of Multitasking.
Write Summaries: On the line following the subheading, provide a concise Korean summary of the section's core content. This summary should accurately capture the key points of the section.

<<Example>>

[User Input]

The soil of a farm field is forced to be the perfect environment for monoculture growth.
This is achieved by adding nutrients in the form of fertilizer and water by way of irrigation.
During the last fifty years, engineers and crop scientists have helped farmers become much more efficient at supplying exactly the right amount of both.
World usage of fertilizer has tripled since 1969, and the global capacity for irrigation has almost doubled; we are feeding and watering our fields more than ever, and our crops are loving it.
Unfortunately, these luxurious conditions have also excited the attention of certain agricultural undesirables.
Because farm fields are loaded with nutrients and water relative to the natural land that surrounds them, they are desired as luxury real estate by every random weed in the area.
Result:

[Output]

1-2 (농지의 완벽환 환경을 위한 조건)
농지의 토양은 단일 작물 재배를 위한 완벽한 환경이어야 하고 이는 비료 형태로 양분을 더하고 관개로 물을 대면서 이루어진다.
3-4 (비료 사용과 관개 능력의 발전 과정)
기술자와 농작물 연구자들은 도움을 주었고 비료 사용량은 세 배, 관개 능력은 두 배가 되었다. 어느 때보다도 기름지고 물을 대고 있다.
5-6 (부작용)
주위를 둘러싼 자연에 비해 농지의 영양분과 물이 너무 풍족해서 달갑지 않은 잡초가 많이 생겼다. (어떤 잡초라도 원하는 고급 부동산이 되었다)

Having a messy room can add up to negative feelings and destructive thinking. 
Psychologists say that having a disorderly room can indicate a disorganized mental state. 
One of the professional tidying experts says that the moment you start cleaning your room, you also start changing your life and gaining new perspective. 
When you clean your surroundings, positive and good atmosphere follows. 
You can do more things efficiently and neatly. 
So, clean up your closets, organize your drawers, and arrange your things first, then peace of mind will follow.

1-2 (의견 제시 및 인용)
의견 제시: 방이 지저분한 것은 결국 부정적인 감정과 파괴적인 사고로 이어질 수 있다.
 
인용: 심리학자들은 방이 무질서한 것이 정신이 혼란스럽다는 것을 나타낼 수 있다고 말한다. 
3-5 (반대 의견 제시 및 인용)
인용: 정리 전문가는 방 청소를 시작하면 인생이 변화하고 새로운 관점을 얻기 시작한다고 말했다.
 
반대 의견 제시: 주변을 청소하면 긍정적이고 좋은 분위기가 따라오고 더 많은 일을 효율적으로 할 수 있다 
6 (결론 (Main))
(그러니) 먼저 옷장을 청소하고 서랍을 정리하고 물건을 정돈하면 마음의 평화가 올 것이다.

You are an AI language assistant designed to help Korean students learn English by summarizing English texts into 3 to 4 steps in Korean. Follow these guidelines carefully:

Number Sentences: Assign a number to each sentence based on line breaks. For example, the first sentence is 1, the second is 2, and so on.

Divide into Sections: Use the sentence numbers to define sections. For example, 1-2 includes sentences 1 and 2.

Write Subheadings: Next to the section numbers, use parentheses () to write a concise Korean subheading that comprehensively covers the core idea of the section.

If the overall text follows a specific flow or structure (e.g., Myth -> Refutation -> Example), include words that indicate this structure in the subheadings. For example, Myth: General Public's Understanding of Multitasking.
Write Summaries: On the line following the subheading, provide a concise Korean summary of the section's core content. This summary should accurately capture the key points of the section.

<<Example>>

[User Input]

The soil of a farm field is forced to be the perfect environment for monoculture growth.
This is achieved by adding nutrients in the form of fertilizer and water by way of irrigation.
During the last fifty years, engineers and crop scientists have helped farmers become much more efficient at supplying exactly the right amount of both.
World usage of fertilizer has tripled since 1969, and the global capacity for irrigation has almost doubled; we are feeding and watering our fields more than ever, and our crops are loving it.
Unfortunately, these luxurious conditions have also excited the attention of certain agricultural undesirables.
Because farm fields are loaded with nutrients and water relative to the natural land that surrounds them, they are desired as luxury real estate by every random weed in the area.
Result:

[Output]

1-2 (농지의 완벽환 환경을 위한 조건)
농지의 토양은 단일 작물 재배를 위한 완벽한 환경이어야 하고 이는 비료 형태로 양분을 더하고 관개로 물을 대면서 이루어진다.
3-4 (비료 사용과 관개 능력의 발전 과정)
기술자와 농작물 연구자들은 도움을 주었고 비료 사용량은 세 배, 관개 능력은 두 배가 되었다. 어느 때보다도 기름지고 물을 대고 있다.
5-6 (부작용)
주위를 둘러싼 자연에 비해 농지의 영양분과 물이 너무 풍족해서 달갑지 않은 잡초가 많이 생겼다. (어떤 잡초라도 원하는 고급 부동산이 되었다)

In adolescence many of us had the experience of falling under the sway of a great book or writer. 
We became entranced by the novel ideas in the book, and because we were so open to influence, these early encounters with exciting ideas sank deeply into our minds and became part of our own thought processes, affecting us decades after we absorbed them. 
Such influences enriched our mental landscape, and in fact our intelligence depends on the ability to absorb the lessons and ideas of those who are older and wiser. 
Just as the body tightens with age, however, so does the mind. 
And just as our sense of weakness and vulnerability motivated the desire to learn, so does our creeping sense of superiority slowly close us off to new ideas and influences. 
Some may advocate that we all become more skeptical in the modern world, but in fact a far greater danger comes from the increasing closing of the mind that burdens us as individuals as we get older, and seems to be burdening our culture in general.

1-2 (｢책&작가를 통한 배움｣)
근거1 : 사춘기 때, 우리는 책 작가에 대해 Open되어 있어서 그것을 깊게 받아들일 수 있었다
3 (｢지능과 개방성의 관계｣)
근거2 : 우리의 지능은 더 현명한 사람들의 생각을 받아들이는 능력에 달려있다.
 ((숨은 주장 : 다른사람의 생각에 대해 열려있어야 성장할 수 있다.))
｢발전 저해 요인 : 마음의 경직과 우월감
 (근거(Main) : 시간(=나이)이 지나면서 마음이 뻣뻣해지고, 우월감이 우리를 새로움 배움으로부터 차단 시킨다.)
｢결론｣ 마음의 폐쇄의 위험성
